bug.author: Lornatang
bug.summary: It doesn't happen in normal time, but an error will be reported in abnormal time
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
Local variable 'l' might be referenced before assignment in models.py 92 line <denchmark-code> j = l[yolo_index] if 'from' in mdef else -1
</denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Add this code to models.py to 79-85 line
<denchmark-code> stride = [32, 16, 8, 4, 2][yolo_index] # P3-P7 stride l = mdef['from'] if 'from' in mdef else [], # output layers modules = YOLOLayer(anchors=mdef['anchors'][mdef['mask']], # anchor list nc=mdef['classes'], # number of classes img_size=img_size, # (416, 416) yolo_index=yolo_index, # 0, 1, 2... layers=l, # output layers stride=stride) </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
Clear this warning <denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
Python == 3.6.9 CUDA & CUDNN == 10.1 PyTorch == 1.4.0 Ubuntu == 18.04 Desktop (please complete the following information):
OS: [Ubuntu] Version [18.04]
Smartphone (please complete the following information):
Device: [ iPhoneXS] OS: [iOS] Version [13.2]
<denchmark-h:h2>Additional context</denchmark-h>
Good luck to you.

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Lornatang>@Lornatang</denchmark-link> you are right! I introduced this bug by accident during a recent commit. I've fixed this now in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/commit/682c2b27e7018c1ff3aae4607c48a2f742a985fe>682c2b2</denchmark-link> . Thanks for the bug report!
This issue is stale because it has been open 30 days with no activity. Remove Stale label or comment or this will be closed in 5 days.
